and their companionship is not devoid of tension. They learn to understand and accept each other during
their expedition. The communities they leave reject them because of their differences and because they can be
dangerous to the group. The laws that govern their tribes of origin can be compared to
those of the Gens de l'eau mère, the country that welcomes them at the very end of the story in "the wonderful land". The
situation of Grenouille and Arbas also evokes the tragedy, experienced closer to home, of migrants fleeing
their homeland where poverty, violence or war prevail, and struggle to find a country where they will feel
welcome and protected.
